content: of 6 stitches in either of the ways described on page 1 work 2 double_crochet into the top of every stitch keep going until you have as much as you want work a few slip stitches to taper the end and fasten_off method - strip squiggle increasing in every stitch make a chain of 25 stitches skip the first chain then work 1 double_crochet into the top of every chain 24 stitches turn work one chain then 2 double_crochet into the top of every stitch 48 stitches turn continue in this way until you have as many row as you want fasten_off method - round squiggle increasing in alternate stitches make a ring of 6 stitches in either of the ways described on page 1 work 1 double_crochet into the first stitch 2 double_crochet into the next stitch repeat this pattern until you have as much as you want work a few slip stitches and fasten_off method - round squiggle increasing in every third stitch make a ring of 6 stitches in either of the ways described on page 1 work 1 double_crochet into each of the first two stitches 2 double_crochet into the next stitch repeat this pattern until you have as much as you want work a few slip stitches and fasten_off you could make strip squiggles with increases in alternate or third stitches but they are much less interesting method - round squiggle increasing in every stitch using trebles shown with blue edging - page 7 into the starting ring work 3 double_crochet 3 half_double_crochet 6 trebles 12 stitches work 2 treble_crochet into the top of every stitch keep going until you have as much as you want work 3 half_double_crochet 3 double_crochet 3 sl-st to taper the end method - rainbow squiggle from the starting ring work 3 chain to serve as first treble then 11 treble_crochet into the ring join with a sl-st 12 stitches change colour work 3 chain and 1 treble_crochet into the first stitch then 2 treble_crochet into each stitch all the way round join with a sl-st repeat for the other colours 3 the tables show you how many stitches there are and how much yarn you will need for each part of a squiggle the amounts might vary considerably if you are using a different yarn in all tables r = the round or row no = the number of stitches in that round or row m/c = main or contrast colour total = number of stitches worked so far metres = approximate number of metres of dk yarn needed increase in every stitch increase in every stitch -
